text: Can't believe something as simple as forgetting a browser tab could make someone a millionaire. This guy must be incredibly lucky!
I mean, I forget to close browser tabs all the time. Where's my million dollars? I guess I've been doing it wrong all these years.
Clearly, you need to level up your tab-forgetting game. Try opening more obscure, high-risk tabs and then forgetting about them for maximum returns.
I'm always amazed at the kind of "accidents" that seem to make people millionaires. Maybe I should just stop trying so hard and let serendipity take over.
Yeah, because nothing says "financial success" like throwing caution to the wind and letting fate decide your future. Good plan!
I mean, isn't that how most startup founders operate anyway? Throw spaghetti at the wall and see what sticks? Fortune favors the bold, or the forgetful in this case.
Can confirm. Once forgot a sandwich in my backpack for a week and it became a lucrative artisanal mold farm. Serendipity is the new business strategy.
This is it. This is the validation I needed for my 100+ open tabs lifestyle. I knew it would pay off one day!
As a fellow tab hoarder, I fully support this statement. We're not messy, we're just playing the long game.
I once had 300+ tabs open on my browser, it felt like I was surfing the web on the edge of a black hole. There must be at least a couple of million dollars hidden in there somewhere.
Good luck trying to find that needle in a haystack of tabs. Better start searching now, maybe by the time you retire you'll have found your fortune.
